title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 572/2002 of 3 April 2002 providing for a further allocation of import rights under Regulation (EC) No 1081/1999 for bulls, cows and heifers other than for slaughter of certain Alpine and mountain breeds
header:
Commission Regulation (EC) No 572/2002
of 3 April 2002
providing for a further allocation of import rights under Regulation (EC) No 1081/1999 for bulls, cows and heifers other than for slaughter of certain Alpine and mountain breeds
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Commission Regulation (EC) No 1081/1999 of 26 May 1999 opening and providing for the administration of tariff quotas for imports of bulls, cows and heifers other than for slaughter of certain Alpine and mountain breeds, repealing Regulation (EC) No 1012/98 and amending Regulation (EC) No 1143/98(1), as amended by Regulation (EC) No 1096/2001(2), and in particular Article 9(3) thereof,
Whereas:
Article 1 of Regulation (EC) No 1081/1999 provides for the opening, for the period 1 July 2001 to 30 June 2002, of two tariff quotas each of 5000 head for bulls, cows and heifers other than for slaughter of certain Alpine and mountain breeds. Article 9 of that Regulation provides for a further allocation, for both quotas, of quantities not covered by import licence applications at 15 March 2002,
main_body:
The quantities referred to in Article 9(1) of Regulation (EC) No 1081/1999 shall be:
- 724 head for serial number 09.0001,
- 589 head for serial number 09.0003.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 4 April 2002.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 3 April 2002.
For the Commission
Franz Fischler
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 131, 27.5.1999, p. 15.
(2) OJ L 150, 6.6.2001, p. 33.
